    org.jnetpcap
    Core libpcap functionality available on all platforms.
    org.jnetpcap.nio
    Native memory and IO management classes.
    org.jnetpcap.packet
    Packet decoding framework.
    org.jnetpcap.packet.structure
    Packet, Header, Field, Binding and Scanner primitives that describe their structure.
    org.jnetpcap.protocol.application
    Application protocol suite.
    org.jnetpcap.protocol.lan
    LAN protocol suite.
    org.jnetpcap.protocol.network
    Network protocol suite.
    org.jnetpcap.protocol.sigtran  
    org.jnetpcap.protocol.tcpip
    Tcp/Ip protocol suite.
    org.jnetpcap.protocol.voip
    Voice Over IP protocol family.
    org.jnetpcap.protocol.vpn
    VPN protocol suite.
    org.jnetpcap.protocol.wan
    WAN protocol suite.
    org.jnetpcap.util
    Various support utility methods.
    org.jnetpcap.util.checksum
    Cyclic Reduncancy Checksum algorithms.
    org.jnetpcap.winpcap
    WinPcap extensions to libpcap avialable on a limited set of platforms.

      org.jnetpcap.protocol.lan��JBuffer������ 
      �޶��������� ���˵��
      class  Ethernet
      Ethernet2 definition.
      class  IEEE802dot1q
      IEEE Vlan header definition.
      class  IEEE802dot2
      IEEE LLC2 header definition.
      class  IEEE802dot3
      IEEE 802.3 data link header definition
      class  IEEESnap
      IEEE SNAP header definition.
      class  NullHeader
      BSD loopback encapsulation; the link-layer header is a 4-byte field, in host byte order, containing a PF_ value from socket.h for the network-layer protocol of the packet.
      class  SLL
      For captures on Linux cooked sockets, we construct a fake header that includes: a 2-byte "packet type" which is one of: LINUX_SLL_HOST packet was sent to us LINUX_SLL_BROADCAST packet was broadcast LINUX_SLL_MULTICAST packet was multicast LINUX_SLL_OTHERHOST packet was sent to somebody else LINUX_SLL_OUTGOING packet was sent *by* us; a 2-byte Ethernet protocol field; a 2-byte link-layer type; a 2-byte link-layer address length; an 8-byte source link-layer address, whose actual length is specified by the previous value.

    • org.jnetpcap.protocol.sigtran��JBuffer��ʹ��

      org.jnetpcap.protocol.sigtran��JBuffer������ 
      �޶��������� ���˵��
      class  Sctp
      In computer networking, the Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) is a transport layer protocol, serving in a similar role to the popular protocols Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) and User Datagram Protocol (UDP).
      class  SctpAbort
      Abort Association (ABORT) (6) The ABORT chunk is sent to the peer of an association to close the association.
      class  SctpChunk
      The figure below illustrates the field format for the chunks to be transmitted in the SCTP packet.
      class  SctpCookie
      Cookie Echo (COOKIE ECHO) (10) This chunk is used only during the initialization of an association.
      class  SctpCookieAck
      Cookie Acknowledgement (COOKIE ACK) (11) This chunk is used only during the initialization of an association.
      class  SctpCWR
      Congestion Window CWR (13) [RFC3168] details a specific bit for a sender to send in the header of its next outbound TCP segment to indicate to its peer that it has reduced its congestion window.
      class  SctpData
      Payload Data (DATA) (0).
      class  SctpECNE
      ECN-Echo (12): [RFC3168] details a specific bit for a receiver to send back in its TCP acknowledgements to notify the sender of the Congestion Experienced (CE) bit having arrived from the network.
      class  SctpError
      Operation Error (ERROR) (9) An endpoint sends this chunk to its peer endpoint to notify it of certain error conditions.
      class  SctpHeartbeat
      Heartbeat Request (HEARTBEAT) (4) An endpoint should send this chunk to its peer endpoint to probe the reachability of a particular destination transport address defined in the present association.
      class  SctpHeartbeatAck
      Heartbeat Acknowledgement (HEARTBEAT ACK) (5) An endpoint should send this chunk to its peer endpoint as a response to a HEARTBEAT chunk (see RFC 4960 Section 8.3).
      class  SctpInit
      Initiation SCTP Chunk(INIT) (1) This chunk is used to initiate an SCTP association between two endpoints.
      class  SctpInitAck
      Initiation Acknowledgement (INIT ACK) (2) The INIT ACK chunk is used to acknowledge the initiation of an SCTP association.
      class  SctpInitBaseclass
      Initiation SCTP Chunk(INIT) (1) & Initiation ACK SCTP Chunk (INIT_ACK) (2) base class.
      static class  SctpInitBaseclass.AddressTypeTLV 
      static class  SctpInitBaseclass.CookieTLV 
      static class  SctpInitBaseclass.HostnameTLV 
      static class  SctpInitBaseclass.Ip4TLV 
      static class  SctpInitBaseclass.Ip6TLV 
      static class  SctpInitBaseclass.StateCookieTLV 
      static class  SctpInitBaseclass.TLV
      Baseclass for Type-Length-Value parameters.
      static class  SctpInitBaseclass.UnrecognizedParametersTLV 
      class  SctpSack
      Selective Acknowledgement (SACK) (3) This chunk is sent to the peer endpoint to acknowledge received DATA chunks and to inform the peer endpoint of gaps in the received subsequences of DATA chunks as represented by their TSNs.
      static class  SctpSack.GapBlock 
      class  SctpShutdown
      Shutdown Association (SHUTDOWN) (7) An endpoint in an association MUST use this chunk to initiate a graceful close of the association with its peer.
      class  SctpShutdownAck
      Shutdown Acknowledgement (SHUTDOWN ACK) (8) This chunk MUST be used to acknowledge the receipt of the SHUTDOWN chunk at the completion of the shutdown process; see RFC 4960 Section 9.2 for details.
      class  SctpShutdownComplete
      Shutdown Complete (SHUTDOWN COMPLETE) (14) This chunk MUST be used to acknowledge the receipt of the SHUTDOWN ACK chunk at the completion of the shutdown process; see RFC 4960 Section 9.2 for details.
      ��������ΪJBuffer��org.jnetpcap.protocol.sigtran�еķ���

    • org.jnetpcap.protocol.tcpip��JBuffer��ʹ��

      org.jnetpcap.protocol.tcpip��JBuffer������ 
      �޶��������� ���˵��
      class  Http
      Hyper Text Transfer Protocol header definition.
      static class  Http.Chunk
      A http chunk that has been encoded during transfer as "Transfer-Encoding: chuncked".
      class  Radius
      Remote Authentication Dial In User Service (RADIUS) is a networking protocol that provides centralized Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA) management for computers to connect and use a network service.
      class  Tcp
      Transmission Control Protocol (TCP).
      static class  Tcp.AlternateChecksum
      The option described in this memo provides a mechanism to negotiate the use of an alternate checksum at connection-establishment time, as well as a mechanism to carry additional checksum information for algorithms that utilize checksums that are longer than 16 bits.
      static class  Tcp.AlternateChecksumRequest
      The option described in this memo provides a mechanism to negotiate the use of an alternate checksum at connection-establishment time, as well as a mechanism to carry additional checksum information for algorithms that utilize checksums that are longer than 16 bits.
      static class  Tcp.Echo
      A simple method for measuring the RTT of a segment would be: the sender places a timestamp in the segment and the receiver returns that timestamp in the corresponding ACK segment.
      static class  Tcp.EchoReply
      A TCP that receives a TCP Echo option containing four information bytes will return these same bytes in a TCP Echo Reply option.
      static class  Tcp.MSS
      The TCP Maximum Segment Size option can be used to specify the maximum segment size that the receiver should use.
      static class  Tcp.NoOp
      No operation.
      static class  Tcp.PartialOrderConnection
      Serves to communicate the information necessary to carry out the job of the protocol - the type of information which is typically found in the header of a TCP segment.
      static class  Tcp.PartialOrderConnectionPermitted
      A service which allows partial order delivery and partial reliability is one which requires some, but not all objects to be received in the order transmitted while also allowing objects to be transmitted unreliably (i.e., some may be lost).
      static class  Tcp.SACK
      TCP may experience poor performance when multiple packets are lost from one window of data.
      static class  Tcp.SACK_PERMITTED
      The TCP SACK permitted option may be sent in a SYN by a TCP that has been extended to receive the SACK option once the connection has opened.
      static class  Tcp.TcpOption
      Options (Variable 0-320 bits, divisible by 32) - The length of this field is determined by the data offset field.
      static class  Tcp.Timestamp
      TCP timestamps, defined in RFC 1323, help TCP compute the round-trip time between the sender and receiver.
      static class  Tcp.WindowScale
      The window scale extension expands the definition of the TCP window to 32 bits and then uses a scale factor to carry this 32 bit value in the 16 bit Window field of the TCP header (SEG.WND in RFC-793).
      class  Udp
      User Datagram Protocol (UDP).
      ��������ΪJBuffer��org.jnetpcap.protocol.tcpip�еķ���

      org.jnetpcap.protocol.voip��JBuffer������ 
      �޶��������� ���˵��
      class  Rtcp
      Baseclass for all Real-Time-Control-Protocol (RTCP) packet-types.
      class  RtcpApp
      APP: Application-Defined RTCP Packet The APP packet is intended for experimental use as new applications and new features are developed, without requiring packet type value registration.
      class  RtcpBye
      BYE: Goodbye RTCP Packet The BYE packet indicates that one or more sources are no longer active.
      class  RtcpReceiverReport
      RR: Receiver Report RTCP Packet The format of the receiver report (RR) packet is the same as that of the SR packet except that the packet type field contains the constant 201 and the five words of sender information are omitted (these are the NTP and RTP timestamps and sender's packet and octet counts).
      class  RtcpSDES
      SDES: Source Description RTCP Packet The SDES packet is a three-level structure composed of a header and zero or more chunks, each of which is composed of items describing the source identified in that chunk.
      static class  RtcpSDES.RtcpSDESChunk 
      static class  RtcpSDES.RtcpSDESItem 
      class  RtcpSenderReport
      SR: Sender Report RTCP Packet The sender report packet consists of three sections, possibly followed by a fourth profile-specific extension section if defined.
      class  RtcpSSRC
      Baseclass for all Real-Time-Control-Protocol (RTCP) packet-types that utilize SSRC/CSRC field in the RTCP header.
      class  Rtp
      The real-time transport protocol (RTP).
      static class  Rtp.Extension
      An extension mechanism is provided to allow individual implementations to experiment with new payload-format-independent functions that require additional information to be carried in the RTP data packet header.
      class  Sdp
      The Session Description Protocol (SDP) is a format for describing streaming media initialization parameters.
      class  Sip
      The Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) is an IETF-defined signaling protocol, widely used for controlling multimedia communication sessions such as voice and video calls over Internet Protocol (IP).
